Class Decryptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alphabet
      • Decryptor

  • public class Decryptor
extends Alphabet
    The Decryptor class is used to print the decrypted version of an encrypted file to the console. It does this by converting the file-to-decrypt to a string, then, through an extension of the Alphabet class, converting the String to it's letter's integer values called the letter's "index". The class reads in the "key" from the file-to-decrypt and, in a similar fashion to the Encryptor class, reads in individual values from the encryption key and subtracts their value from the letter index before finally converting the index back to a string.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

      • getEncryptedPhraseFromTxt

        public static java.lang.String getEncryptedPhraseFromTxt(java.lang.String filePath)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in phrase-to-decrypt from the text file as well as the codexKey from the top of the file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - User specified file path to file-to-decrypt
        Returns:
        Returns the phrase from the file-to-decrypt in the form of a string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException if method cannot reach file-to-decrypt

      • cleanPhraseAndGetKey

        public int cleanPhraseAndGetKey()
        Isolates the encryption key and encrypted phrase from each other
        Returns:
        returns the integer value of the codexKey

      • shiftIndexForDecryption

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> shiftIndexForDecryption()
        Converts the originalPhrase to it's corresponding letter index. After this the method reads in integer values from the "codex" (encryption-codexKey) starting at the "codexKey"'s value. Each letter index is subtracted from the encryption-key's value and then shifted within the range 0-26 using Alphabet's indexValidity checker. The resulting letter index is saved to the instance variable shiftedIndex.
        Returns:
        returns an ArrayList of Integers containing the shifted index

      • printDecryptedPhrase

        public java.lang.String printDecryptedPhrase()
        Calls the convertIndexToText from the Alphabet class and returns the resulting string
        Returns:
        String of decrypted letters which will later be printed to the console
